Pre-Game Insights: India and Syria will go head-to-head for the Intercontinental Cup 2024 trophy in the third and final game of the tournament at the GMC Balayogi Athletic Stadium in Hyderabad on Monday, September 9, 2024, at 19:30 IST.
India began the competition with a 0-0 draw against Mauritius and are eyeing their second consecutive Intercontinental Cup, and third overall.
Syria beat Mauritius 2-0, holding a slight advantage as they require only a draw to claim the trophy.
India head coach Manolo Márquez emphasized the importance of playing good football over merely winning the tournament.
Defender Jay Gupta highlighted the positive atmosphere in the dressing room and the team's focus on adapting to the coach's strategies.
Syria's new head coach José Lana was satisfied with their opening-game display and aims to improve against India.
Syrian goalkeeper Ahmad Madania mentioned that the team is technically and psychologically ready for the match against India.
